intro: Tripleurospermum baytopianum, commonly known as the Baytopian Daisy, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Baytopia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features silver-green, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing bright yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. This species is often found in meadows and along the edges of woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
